titleStmt.title: R. L. Garvin to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1800

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Munfordville Ky
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlet Governor of Ky March 8th 1864
My Dear Sir

Circumstances have come up that make it necessary that I should resign my office as Justice of the Peace for Hart County (which I have been an incumbent for the last 10 or 12 years pleace accept this resignation. I have conversed with a majority of the persons that reside in this end of the district & they all concur & request you to appoint C C Larimore as my sucessor. who I think will give general Satisfaction & Oblige your
I am well acquainted with Mr Laremor I think he would be a good appointment

Wm Gardner Presiding
Judge of the Hart County Court

Hart Co
J. P
Resigned
Accptd
11th Mch/64
